On DATE the applicant was informed that he was the subject of a criminal investigation and placed in pre - trial detention on the charge of indecent assault by a person abusing the authority conferred on him by his duties . He was accused of indecently assaulting a woman patient during a vaginal and rectal examination while he was a houseman at a hospital in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant was released under judicial supervision on DATE . He was required not to enter the urban district of GPE , save in obedience to a summons ; to report once DATE to GPE police station ; to hand over his passport and identity card to the registry of the investigating judge ; to refrain from entering into contact with the victim ; and to deposit MONEY ( FRF ) with the registrar of the criminal court .

CARDINAL . An order of CARDINAL DATE partially modifying the conditions of judicial supervision enabled the applicant to travel to GPE DATE . A second application for modification of the conditions of judicial supervision , whereby the applicant sought permission to begin a DATE course of study in GPE , was refused by the investigating judge in a decision of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . By an order dated CARDINAL DATE , the applicant was committed for trial in ORG .

CARDINAL . After his trial on DATE , which the applicant attended in person , ORG sentenced him to CARDINAL GPE imprisonment , with one of those DATE suspended , and ordered him to pay ORG CARDINAL in damages to the civil party . The applicant was not present when judgment was delivered on DATE .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG , after a hearing which was also attended by the applicant , upheld the impugned judgment with regard to the finding of guilt but increased the sentence to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment , with CARDINAL of those years suspended , and the damages awarded to the civil party to ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL . It did not issue a warrant for the applicant ’s arrest .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant gave notice of an appeal on points of law against the above judgment .

CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE , sent to his home in GPE , the applicant was informed by ORG at ORG that he was required to surrender to custody on DATE before the hearing in ORG at the latest , pursuant to LAW , and that the hearing in ORG had been set down for DATE .

CARDINAL . By a request submitted through his lawyer on DATE , the applicant applied to ORG , under LAW , for exemption from the obligation to surrender to custody before the hearing at which his appeal on points of law was to be examined by ORG .

CARDINAL . In support of the above request the applicant , who had returned to GPE after ORG judgment of DATE , produced a medical certificate dated DATE from a professor at a GPE hospital which stated that he had bacilliform pulmonary tuberculosis , first diagnosed in DATE . This required him to take sick - leave from work and rest for DATE , the time needed for intensive treatment of the contagious disease .

CARDINAL . The applicant asserted that in those circumstances he could not leave NORP territory , that his state of health excluded any possibility of his undergoing imprisonment and that making the admissibility of his appeal on points of law depend on his prior incarceration breached LAW .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , following a hearing which the applicant did not attend , but at which he was represented by his lawyer , ORG , rejecting ORG submissions , refused the request on the following grounds :

“ Although the medical certificates produced show the onset of bacilliform pulmonary tuberculosis in DATE , and the prescription of CARDINAL months’ rest from DATE onwards , they do not establish either that it is impossible for Mr GPE to travel and to follow a course of treatment appropriate to his condition in GPE or that any possibility of imprisonment is excluded , as alleged . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( c ) of the ORG does not give defendants the right to decline to appear before the courts but only the right , if they do appear , to defend themselves in person or with the assistance of a lawyer . Consequently , the provisions of LAW do not appear to be contrary in any way to the principles set out above ... ”

CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG declared the applicant ’s right to appeal on points of law forfeit , on the ground that he had not surrendered to custody and had not obtained an exemption from the obligation to do so .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW are the following :

“ Judgments of indictment divisions , and judgments delivered in connection with serious crimes , lesser indictable offences and summary offences against which no ordinary appeal lies , may be quashed in the event of a breach of the law on an appeal on points of law lodged by ORG or by a party affected to his detriment ...
The appeal must be lodged with ORG . ”

The cases where an appeal on points of law lies for a breach of the law are listed in ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL as : failure to give reasons , exceeding authority , failure to reply to submissions and , where lesser indictable offences are concerned , imposition of a penalty not prescribed by law .

“ During the time allowed for an appeal on points of law and , where such an appeal has been lodged , until ORG delivers judgment , execution of the judgment of the court of appeal shall be stayed , except in respect of orders concerning civil matters , and unless the court of appeal upholds the warrant issued by the trial court pursuant to LAW , first sub - paragraph , or unless it issues a warrant itself under the same conditions and according to the same rules . ”

“ If a person sentenced to a term of imprisonment of DATE has not surrendered to custody and has not obtained from the court which convicted him , with or without payment of a surety , exemption from the obligation to surrender to custody , his right to appeal on points of law shall be forfeit .
The memorandum of imprisonment or the judgment granting exemption shall be produced before ORG not later than the time when the case is called for hearing .

For his appeal to be admissible , it is sufficient for the appellant to establish that he has surrendered to custody at a prison , either in the place where ORG sits or in the place where sentence was passed . The governor of that prison shall admit him there on the order of ORG at ORG or of the head of the public prosecutor ’s office at the court of trial or appeal . ”

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure has been amended by Law no . CARDINAL of DATE , which increased the length of the term of imprisonment contemplated therein from DATE . The rest of Article CARDINAL is unchanged .
